item.title: About
item.description:
I am a fourth-year mathematics major with a concentration in statistics at Grinnell College.

My undergraduate studies span probability theory, data science, and statistical/machine learning, and I code in Python and R.

I work as a peer mentor at Grinnell College’s Data Analysis and Social Inquiry Lab, a grader for the statistics department, and a member of the Statistics SEPC – a student government body that assists in the faculty hiring and review process within their respective departments, among other responsibilities.

item.title: Personal
item.description:
In my spare time, I enjoy staying active through running, weightlifting, and pickleball.

I also love music: I play the drums and collect albums on CD. My favorite artists include Death Grips, Miles Davis (particularly the era of the Second great Quintet from 1961-1968), and billy woods.

Finally, I have committed to watching some of the major prestige dramas from the “Golden Age of Television.” Currently, I am working through The Sopranos.

item.title: Research
item.description:
Overview Link to heading

My primary research interests are stochastic processes and statistical/machine learning with applications in biology and public health.

Iowa Summer Institute in Biostatistics 2025 Link to heading

In the summer of 2025, I joined the Iowa Summer Institute in Biostatistics. In addition to completing introductory biostatistics coursework and learning about the field through conversations with professors, graduate students, and researchers, I completed a research project under the advisement of the University of Iowa’s Dr. Patrick Breheny.
